column4: watson516 if installing from the *.run file you won't need it anyways, something else is awry... And I'm not sure I got any idea what...
I wonder which driver is providing wlan0 then
He probably needs to unload whatever that would be and probe the bcm module (the broadcom driver module is 'bcmxxxx' or it at least has bcm in the name, right?)
bcm203x would be my guess, as to what provides wlan0, no clue... kernel usually means I'm way to deep in, above my head...
Since he says it's a bcm4306 I'm gonna go with bcm3510 for now ;)
I think that's gone in karmic..
I believe it works again, now
